str2: On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
Once, once for all. Probably from hapas; one time.
Twice, entirely, utterly. Adverb from duo; twice.
An adversary, Satan. Of Chaldee origin corresponding to ma'bad; the accuser, i.e. The devil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To interrupt, hinder. From en and kopto; to cut into, i.e. impede, detain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
